structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Times And Places For Holding Courts
law.text: [ Text of section effective until July 1, 2012. For text effective July 1, 2012, see below.] The court shall be held by one of the justices, and when so held shall have and exercise all the power and jurisdiction committed to said court. The chief justice, after consultation with the chief justice for administration and management of the trial court, shall make such assignments for the attendance of a justice at the several times and places appointed for holding the court as will be most convenient as will insure the prompt performance of its duties.
